Healthcare Management at Regent University

Regent University appears in our ranking of the Top 20 Online Healthcare Law Degree Programs.

Future healthcare management professionals can choose from six programs at Regent University. Programs include the Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies – Healthcare Management or the Master of Business Administration (MBA) – Healthcare Management. Within the programs, students will learn about key issues like healthcare legislation, medical malpractice, corporate liability, and patient rights.

Other programs related to healthcare management at the university include the Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership – Healthcare Management, the Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies – Nursing Home Administration, and the Master of Science in Nursing – Nurse Leadership & Management. The university also offers a healthcare leadership doctorate that offers students the chance to become a published author in healthcare publications.

Students who choose the undergraduate program can enroll on campus or online, and students with previous college experience may be eligible to transfer credits into the program. Earning the degree means completing at least 120 credit hours, and students will complete classes within the university’s approved degree plan. Students will take several general education courses in areas like Christianity, critical thinking, and mathematics, as well as courses focused on their area of study.

Overall, students will take 21 hours in healthcare management courses, as well as have the opportunity to choose 26 hours of electives. At least 50 percent of the major requirements for the degree must be taken at Regent University. Graduates of the bachelor’s degree program may want to expand on their knowledge by considering the Master of Arts in Law – Healthcare Law program.

For the university’s graduate degrees, students will usually enroll online and complete somewhere between 30 and 35 credit hours. The university shares that career opportunities for graduates in healthcare management include those of hospital or emergency medical administrators, group practice executive leaders, or nursing home managers. Classes students may take in the university’s graduate programs include Healthcare Policy & Ethics, Health Care Law, and Managing Change in Healthcare Organizations.

For the DSL in Healthcare Leadership option, students will need to complete 60 hours of online study, which also includes some time spent in residency at the campus. The doctoral program is offered by the School of Business & Leadership. The residency requirements include two trips to the campus that each require four days of study and in-class instruction.

About Regent University

Regent University is a private university affiliated with Christianity that was founded by televangelist Pat Robertson in the 1970s. Once known as the Christian Broadcasting Network University, the school would change its name to Regent University in 1990. The university instructs students from its suburban campus in Virginia Beach, and it also offers online programs on some subjects. The university’s official colors are blue and green, and sports teams play as the Royals.

Around 8,600 students attend the university, which considers itself an interdenominational Evangelical institution. The university once had a satellite campus in Alexandria, Virginia, but it sold that location in 2008. Programs at Regent University are delivered from within eight academic schools, and students can pursue associate, bachelor’s, master’s, and doctoral degree programs. More than 70 courses of study are available to students.

Regent University Accreditation Details

Regional accreditation for Regent University has been awarded by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges, which allows the university to award college degrees. The university’s students are able to receive loans from the federal government’s student loan program while the university remains accredited.

Some individual programs are also accredited. Approvals come from the American Bar Association, which has accredited the School of Law, as well as the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs, which has accredited the Master of Arts in Clinical Mental Health and other related programs. Approvals have also been earned by the Commission of the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation.

Regent University Application Requirements

Admission to Regent University requires completion of four steps for recent high school graduates. Applicants will complete the online application, submit a $50 nonrefundable application fee, and submit unofficial transcripts. Students can also submit a fee waiver for the application fee. The application process also requires the delivery of standardized test scores and a personal statement. The university accepts the ACT or the SAT.

Admissions to graduate programs at Regent University require that students submit their information to the department that offers the student’s chosen degree program. The university regularly holds admissions events for students who have questions about attending the university, and many of these events are held online, so students can attend from anywhere that has an internet connection. Generally, graduate programs grade applications on academic achievements, writing quality, and leadership experience.

Tuition and Financial Aid

Regent University indicates that its tuition rate is half of the average amount for private universities in the United States. Financial aid is available to students enrolled in on-campus study, as well as students pursuing online degrees. Tuition for on-campus study where students enroll in 12 to 18 credit hours is $8,610. The rate for part-time study is $605 per credit, and students who enroll in more than 18 credits in a semester will pay $574 for each credit over 18.

The estimate for books and supplies ranges from $1,000 to $1,500, and students will pay an estimated $13,255 to $13,500 for room and board. Students may need to budget additional funds if they plan to attend college during the summer session. For graduate students, the amount charged for tuition depends on a student’s program. For example, the Master of Arts program is $675 per credit, and online students will also pay a $550 university services fee, as well as a $100 enrollment deposit.

Financial aid is available to students who qualify at Regent University. Students should submit their application through the federal government’s Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) website. Applicants may need to submit additional documentation, and the university will process the student’s application when all materials have been received. Applicants will receive information on their financial aid award before classes begin.
